Uses of Class
org.bytedeco.liquidfun.b2Joint

  • Packages that use b2Joint 
    Package Description
    org.bytedeco.liquidfun  

    • Uses of b2Joint in org.bytedeco.liquidfun

      Subclasses of b2Joint in org.bytedeco.liquidfun 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  b2DistanceJoint
      A distance joint constrains two points on two bodies to remain at a fixed distance from each other.
      class  b2FrictionJoint
      Friction joint.
      class  b2GearJoint
      A gear joint is used to connect two joints together.
      class  b2MotorJoint
      A motor joint is used to control the relative motion between two bodies.
      class  b2MouseJoint
      A mouse joint is used to make a point on a body track a specified world point.
      class  b2PrismaticJoint
      A prismatic joint.
      class  b2PulleyJoint
      The pulley joint is connected to two bodies and two fixed ground points.
      class  b2RevoluteJoint
      A revolute joint constrains two bodies to share a common point while they are free to rotate about the point.
      class  b2RopeJoint
      A rope joint enforces a maximum distance between two points on two bodies.
      class  b2WeldJoint
      A weld joint essentially glues two bodies together.
      class  b2WheelJoint
      A wheel joint.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      b2Joint b2World.CreateJoint(b2JointDef def)
      Create a joint to constrain bodies together.

      Get the first joint.
      b2Joint b2GearJoint.GetJoint2()
      Get the second joint.
      b2Joint b2World.GetJointList()
      Get the world joint list.
      b2Joint b2Joint.GetNext()
      Get the next joint the world joint list.
      b2Joint b2JointEdge.joint()
      the joint
      b2Joint b2GearJointDef.joint1()
      The first revolute/prismatic joint attached to the gear joint.
      b2Joint b2GearJointDef.joint2()
      The second revolute/prismatic joint attached to the gear joint.

      void b2DestructionListener.SayGoodbye(b2Joint joint)
      Called when any joint is about to be destroyed due to the destruction of one of its attached bodies.
